newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean shares end firm, retail sector shines.
newsitem.headline: Chilean shares end firm, retail sector shines.

text.p: Chilean shares closed broadly higher in modest trade with recently-launched retail stocks including supermarket D&S and department store Falabella among the top gainers, said dealers.
The bolsa is seen stable next week with little clear direction, they said.
The 40-share .IPSA index ended up 0.48 percent at 115.88 points. The general .IGPAu index gained 0.41 percent to 5,362.85 points amid volume of 10.4 billion pesos.
Traders reported the bolsa buoyed by speculation that the Central Bank would cut interest rates after a board meeting Thursday, said traders.
But no interest rate cut had materialized by Friday evening.
Retail stocks, the bolsa's star performers this year, climbed on optimism that they will offer far higher returns than slower-growth issues including electricity shares, they said.
Trader said pension funds, traditionally market leaders, having been pushing into the commercial sector in recent months.
"Recently a lot of pension funds have gone out and sold electricity stocks to enter others, like the retail industry," said one trader.
D&S climbed 8.57 percent to 380 pesos, while Falabella gained 4.07 percent to 435 pesos.

Losers included power utility Edelnor, down 5.5 percent at 255 pesos, financial group CruzBlanca, down 1.6 percent at 120 pesos and electricity generator Chilgener which lost 0.77 percent to 2,441 pesos.
